name: WRAAC Dutch Treat
author: WRAAC / BikeBike
comments: Pancake flat loop with canal double track and some gravel. Beginner friendly.

name: WRAAC Ware Ridge Loop
author: WRAAC / BikeBike
comments: A classic loop between Millarville and Turner Valley. Very beginner friendly.

name: 99 Problems but Gravel Ain't One
author: Chris Roy
comments: Great loop with high percentage gravel starting at Big Hill Springs. Golf course food/drinks just past the halfway point. Give the farm track roads a few days to dry after rain. Pretty beginner friendly with relatively easy climbs.

name: Tour de Rosebud Stubby Edition
author: Niels van Ommeren
comments: Inspired by the Hurt'n Albert'n route, this loop goes through the valley three times. Great views. 3 tough climbs. County likes to grade frequently.  No amenities. Ride clockwise if you want to front-load the climbs.

name: McLean - Coalmine Loop
author: Niels van Ommeren
comments: McLean creek and Coalmine road connected together. Save some energy for northbound Coalmine road.

name: WRAAC Gorge Creek Loop
author: WRAAC / BikeBike
comments: Beautiful remote Gorge Creek, looped together with part of Ware Ridge. Bring your climbing gears. Approximately 84km if starting from Millarville with 1100m elevation.

name: Bragg Creek - Powderface Loop
author: Niels van Ommeren
comments: Mixed surface loop with a mostly downhill paved stretch back into Bragg Creek. 50/50 paved/dirt with nice views.

name: Turner Valley Figure 8ish Gravel and Backroads
author: Niels van Ommeren
comments: Surprisingly tough but scenic figure 8 with plenty of refuelling stops. "Trespass" section just east of Longview, so ride at your own risk.

name: Nanton 80K Gravel Speciale
author: Niels van Ommeren
comments: 80km loop out of Nanton of nearly all gravel. Amazing views. Very steep climbs. Fast descents. Some of the best the area has to offer. No Amenities. Post ride Dairy Queen blizzards.

name: Extrabigly Motoburrito Ride
author: Niels van Ommeren
comments: The fun way to ride to Turner Valley/Motoburrito! Plenty of climbing and great views of the Turner Valley area. Some of the best gravel and back roads in the area. Long climbs, punchy steep short climbs, farm track.

name: Ghost of the Gravel
author: Deadgoat Racing
comments: The Ghost of the Gravel race route. Usually fast gravel and very little pavement. Many punchy climbs in the second half makes this a tough race course.

name: Priddis/Turner Valley Gravel and Backroads Century
author: Niels van Ommeren
comments: Mixed surface ride connecting a lot of the great gravel and paved roads between Priddis / Turner Valley / Calgary. Various options for shortcuts and water/food.

name: Powderface - Barrier Lake - Little Elbow Loop
author: Niels van Ommeren
amenities: Yes - Kananaskis Village & Boulton Creek Campground
comments: Tough loop best done with 40+mm tubeless tires and climbing gears. High elevation means this is better done later in the season. Remote and beautiful.

name: Nanton - Crowsnest Overnighter Loop
author: Niels van Ommeren
comments: More of a bikepacking/fastpacking loop. Bring a water filter and bear spray. Plenty of elevation. High percentage gravel. Long stretches with no food/cell service. Hwy40 best traveled on weekdays.

name: Markerville Ice Cream Loop
author: Mark Kudryk
amenities: Yes, Markerville Creamery, Eckville gas station
comments: The NW and SE legs are very nice, but the gravel varies a lot so you need to keep on your toes. This routing goes all the way north to Eckville to stop at the GTI gas stations for replenishments and bathroom break. It's possible to cut this out by heading east on Hwy 11 and going straight to Benalto. In Benalto there is the Caravelle Cafe, which is currently (July 25th) undergoing renovations, but should be opened early-to-mid September.

name: Lochend Ponds Loop
author: EVCC
comments: Gravel ride on quiet roads, with only 1.5km of pavement. Brown sections are clay surface and may be impassable when wet.

name: Old Porcupine's Choice Bikepack Route
author: WRAAC / BikeBike
comments: Multi-surface bikepacking loop that takes you from ranchlands into the Rockies and back again. Only 33kms of the loop is pavements.

name: Tuner Valley Short
author: Russ Harper
comments: TBD

name: Drumheller 100km
author: Dean Anderson
comments: It's 100km for the whole thing. Or, you can cut off the extension up to Gartly and head back on HWY 56 or 576 for 50km or 60km loops respectively. Or, you can do the Gartly portion and cut off the the Tyrell Museum loop and head back on HWY 56 for an 80km loop

name: Drumheller Gravel Ripper
author: Ian Turnbull
comments: Great route, some steep climbs and a rough one to start out of Nacmine, lots of variety

name: Airdrie Gravel Speciale
author: Scott MacKenzie
comments: Fun mixed surface route, dirt and gravel and pavement and....

name: Airdrie Range Road Loop
author: Scott MacKenzie
comments: A bit of everything including "range roads" through farm fields and more

name: Airdrie Gravel Shorty
author: Scott MacKenzie
comments: Simple loop exploring some of the township / range roads east of Airdrie

name: Frank Lake Loop
author: Sally Zerk
comments: Some super fun hard packed dirt trail round the lake which is actually a wetland conservation area) and a whole mixture of different gravel and thicknesses on the route as a whole

name: Plateau Mountain Road
author: The Gravel Experience
comments: Amazing climb. Unlike Anything else around here.￼Did it as a gravel everesting recon; would be a great Climb for it, but a couple of the downhill sections would be sketchy if you tired and are hand burners. 20 repeats would be an Everest. Definitely worth trying the route. ￼￼￼

name: WRAAC Dutch Dinner
author: WRAAC / BikeBike
comments: If you like the WRAAC Dutch Treat route, this is similar but longer. Canals and quiet farm roads with a bonus viewpoint overlooking the Bow River at around the halfway mark.

name: WRAAC Hillcrest Mtn Rounder
author: WRAAC / BikeBike
comments: This route heads south from the Crowsnest Pass towards the Castle Wilderness on Lynx Creek Rd then loops back to Blairmore on Adanac Rd. Big climbs and fast descents await. No cell service and no services at all along the way so plan accordingly. amping available in Blairmore at the Lost Lemon Campground, there are random camping zones on the southern segment of Lynx Creek Rd, and Lynx Creek Campground is located on Carbondale Rd.

name: WRAAC Porcupine Loop
author: WRAAC / BikeBike
comments: Starting and finishing at the Maycroft Provincial Rec Area this route takes you through historic ranchlands, up into the Porcupine Hills, and back again. Loaded with spectacular views, significant climbing , and equal amounts of descending, this route will tingle all the senses.At the top of East Sharples Road (after the switchbacks) you have a choice to do the loop in either direction. There are no services and no water so bring extra and be prepared. Enjoy a lunch at the viewpoint POI overlooking the front range of the Rockies. Finish with a dip in the Old Man River and you've done this route right.

name: Porci's Revenge
author: Niels van Ommeren
comments: Similar to the Porcupine Loop, this takes on the Southern section. Looped counterclockwise to avoid headwind.

name: Porci's Revenge XL
author: Niels van Ommeren
comments: Porci's Revenge but with Porcupine Loop added.

name: Porci's Revenge XXL
author: Niels van Ommeren
comments: Circumnavigate the entire Porcupine Hills. This looks damning.

name: Stavely - Porcupine Durt Locker
author: Niels van Ommeren
comments: Hit the North end of Porcupine Hills and loop back on Riley Road into Stavely. Do not ride unless it's been dry a few days.

name: Priddis B-Road Longboi
author: Niels van Ommeren
comments: Mostly paved, with two great gravel sections. Lots of elevation and back roads connecting the best the Priddis area has to offer.

name: Dirty Alta 2019
author: Greg Nicholson
comments: Skogan Pass for alternate route. Can also skip HRT and ride on the road.

name: Minnewanka Loop
author: Greg Nicholson
comments: Must be done outside seasonal closure of Minnewanka to bikes

name: Finnegan's Wake
author: Aaron Falkenberg
comments: Longest gravel climb in the Red Deer River Valley.  Ferry ride

name: Cypress Hills Massacre
author: Lyndon Cousins
comments: Dry only

name: February Nanton Ride
author: Sonya Laing
comments: Prepare for lots of climbing!

name: Da Hump Plus Gravel
author: Sonya Laing
comments: Start and finish at Hwy 22 and 532 (top of Chain Lakes), make sure to start your computer at the highway or you'll miss the segment. We went past Da Hump so the ride is shorter if you go to the top and return. Hang onto your teeth on the way back down and make sure you're not there during prime 4x4/off road/camping hours. That road is busy.

name: Sunday Gravel with Ray
author: Sonya Laing
comments: Start and finish south Okotoks, explore area between Okotoks and High River

name: Frank Lake Loop
author: Sonya Laing
comments: Start and finish northside parking at Frank Lake (straight east of High River), ride inspired by Jason & Sally Zerk, if you take out the south out and back, there is literally NO elevation on this one.

name: Who doesen't love a painted pony?
author: Jeremy Neufeld
comments: Start and finish DeWinton Community Hall, original ride credit Jeremy Neufeld

name: Wyndham - Carseland PP-Canal-Arrowwood Loop
author: Sonya Laing
comments: Start and finish Wyndham-Carsland PP entrance (gates were closed)

name: 48 Street Date Night Loop
author: Tom M
comments: Start and finish anywhere in downtown Okotoks because you ride right through (this one started at my house so I don't recommend that), Tom M ride credit - Uncle Giggles originally showed me a version of this ride

name: HCC Monday Gravel Loop
author: Jeremy Neufeld
comments: Start and finish around Red Deer Meats or use Granary Road corner, original ride credit Jeremy Neufeld

name: HCC / Big Rock Gravel Ride
author: Jeremy Neufeld
comments: Start / finish at Okotoks Big Rock, Hwy 7

name: Beaver Creek Buffalo Jump Willow Creek Gravel Ride
author: Sonya Laing
comments: Started with a short shuttle just west of Claresholm and ended up in Claresholm.

name: Beaver Creek Explore  - Gravel
author: Sonya Laing
comments: You can get your shuttle driver to drop you off at the southend of the Skyline road, west of Claresholm and pick you up at The Head Smashed In Buffalo Jump, west of Ft. McLeod.

name: Writing on Stone Gravel Loop
author: Sonya Laing
comments: Start and finish at WoS

name: HCC 5-1-3 Gravel Ride
author: Sonya Laing
comments: Start and finish in Okotoks

name: HCC Gravel Ride
author: Sonya Laing
comments: Multisurface exploring south of Okotoks

name: Gladys Ridge Gravel Explore
author: Sonya Laing
comments: Start and finish eastside of Aldersyde overpass, the out 'n back has the coolest barn ever!

name: Chapel Rock and the Oldman
author: Peter Churchill
amenities: Lundbreck, get food and water there
comments: Difficulty depends on wind and a bit subjective but 3 if not too windy. No water or food enroute except from river. There is a brewery in Lundbreck for post ride re-hydration.

name: Castle River Ramble
author: Peter Churchill
comments: A 3 or 4 again depending on wind. Water and a beautiful lunch stop at Castle Falls campground/ day use. Lots of options to shorten the ride by starting at Beaver Mines. Pack Bear Spray on this one. A couple of gates to hop but allowed for hikers and bikers.

name: Half Cross your Fngers Millarville
author: Chris Roy
amenities: N/A, nothing en route for amenities

name: McLean Sheep Gravel Loop
author: Chris Roy
amenities: Black Diamond area, nothing en route

name: Ghost of the Gravel
author: Sarns
comments: Epic!

name: Gorge Creek Overnighter
author: Chris Roy
comments: Big route!

name: In Search of the Giant Chicken
author: Sonya Laing
comments: Start and finish at Tim Horton's Black Diamond, you can always split this route in two to cut the distance

name: In Search of the Giant Chicken (shorty)
author: Sonya Laing
comments: Shorter version but you miss the awesome out and back!

name: Claresholm Gravel Ride
author: Sonya Laing
comments: Start and finish at Sonya's Mom's house lol!

name: Claresholm Gravel Shorty
author: Sonya Laing
comments: Start and finish at Sonya's Mom's house lol! An easy and fun explore...

name: Rockyford, Rosebud, Wayne Gravel Loops
author: Chris Roy
comments: Gorrgeous scenery, lots of coulees etc.

name: Windmills and Buffalo Jumps
author: Chris Roy
amenities: Pincher Creek? Head Smashed In Buffalo Jump

name: Sirocco 50/50
author: Chris Roy
amenities: Calgary, fuel up before you leave the city

name: Wintering HIlls
author: Aaron Falkenberg
amenities: East Coulee Museum cafe.  Atlas Coal mine store.
comments: Feel that turbine wind in your hair, and grab some field peas if you start to bonk.

name: The Stegosaurus: All the Gravel Vert!
author: Aaron Falkenberg
comments: The "spine" is paved, everything else is gravel.

name: WRAAC Nanton Hills
author: Sean Carter
amenities: N/A bring your own water and snacks
comments: A long 6km climb and a 9km descent highglihgts this cool route

name: Priddis 100K Route
author: David Stewart
comments: Gravel, dirt and a bit of pavement

name: High Rockies
author: Ryan Correy
comments: Check out "Bikepacking in the Canadian Rockies: book for more info

name: Rosebud - Drumheller Loop
author: David Pugh
comments: The rail line from Rosebud to Wayne is still deep gravel rail bed.  2"+ tires (even fatbike). Some gaps on the abandonded bridges.

name: Priddis 70K Loop
author: David Stewart
amenities: Priddis at the start of the route and thats it

name: Crossfield Donut Burner Stubby Version
author: Niels van Ommeren
comments: make sure to stop at The Donut Man for donuts!

name: Crossfield Donut Burner
author: Niels van Ommeren
comments: make sure to stop at The Donut Man for donuts!

name: Crossfield Donut Burner Short
author: Niels van Ommeren
comments: make sure to stop at The Donut Man for donuts!

name: Ware Ridge Alternate
author: Niels van Ommeren
comments: Check out Fahr brewery after in Turner Valley

name: WRAAC Majorville Medicine Wheel
author: WRAAC / BikeBike
comments: Do not block drivways or access roads, don't ride in wet conditions. watch for cattle guards, the yellow segment goes through a "closed" section thought the gates are open and are not private property
